actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

official_title: To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit congressional leadership committees and to restrict contributions between principal campaign committees of congressional candidates.

summary.text: Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit a congressional candidate from establishing, maintaining, financing, or controlling a political committee, other than the principal campaign committee of the candidate. Prohibits the principal campaign committee of a congressional candidate from making contributions to any other principal campaign committee (other than the principal campaign committee of the same individual as a candidate for another Federal office).

titles.title: To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit congressional leadership committees and to restrict contributions between principal campaign committees of congressional candidates.
